fehd.ADR_EN: SHOP NO. 1, G/F., KING HO BUILDING, NOS. 41-49 ABERDEEN STREET, HONG KONG
fehd.ADR_TC: 香港鴨巴甸街41-49號金豪大廈地下1號舖

geocode_en.formatted_address: Shop 1, G/F, King Ho Building, 49 Aberdeen St, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong

geocode_tc.formatted_address: Shop 1, G/F, King Ho Building, 49 Aberdeen St, Sheung Wan, 香港

result.adr_address: Shop 1, G/F, King Ho Building, 49 Aberdeen St, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
result.formatted_address: Shop 1, G/F, King Ho Building, 49 Aberdeen St, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
result.name: Bun Cha Vietnamese Cafe (SoHo)

reviews.text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. I came right at 18:00 and there was minimal takeout volume, so it felt like I had the place to myself. The cabbage and chicken salad was almost perfect, to my liking. Excellent level of shred, variety of species, and level of dressing. Crunch was supreme. 

Bun Cha was deconstructed and lukewarm, totally fine. All greens were terrifically fresh; it was a little strange how short the noodles were cut up. A little sweet, salty bowl of broth was really great. Overall, fresh and well executed in a no frills storefront.

I could feel myself being transported back to Vietnam while eating the banh mi and drinking coffee with condensed milk here! Such a quaint food haven amidst the hustle and bustle of Sheung Wan. There's even an outside section for those who like to look out and observe the surrounding neighborhood while eating. The staff is also very nice and welcoming. I went on a Sunday afternoon at around 2, so maybe I avoided the lunch rush, but it was nice being seated straight away. Such a wonderful little spot! I will definitely come back with friends.
This is the best traditional Vietnamese restaurant I have been to in Hong Kong. Very simple place, with decent service and reasonable prices. Amazing pho.

Surprisingly delicious Bun Cha Hanoi after visiting Bun Cha Hang Quat in Hanoi we have been craving it since we got back. The BBQ beef is wonderful with just the right cuts and good amount of fat. The Cha is quite delicious but lacking that extra sweetness and tang Hang Quat held. Deep fried springrolls are some of the best we've had and the BBQ chicken skewers are crispy on the outside and deliciously juicy and tender on the inside. Bun Cha has become and instant favorite. Don't forget to TIP! No service charge!

A honest place serving simple and tasty Vietnamese dishes, their pho is the main draw for me to visit. I always return to this restaurant for a quick bite every time I visit Hong Kong. They also serve fresh coconut water in a coconut!

result.vicinity: King Ho Building, Shop 1, G/F, 49 Aberdeen Street, Sheung Wan
